name: Flexor Tenosynovitis with Partial Tendon Rupture
chief_complaint: I can't bend my ring finger properly, and it's swollen and painful
symptoms: Pain along the flexor tendon sheath
Swelling in the palm and finger
physical_findings: Fusiform swelling along the tendon sheath
Pain with passive extension of the finger
Mild erythema over the A2 pulley region
treatment: Possible surgical exploration if no improvement in 48 hours
prognosis: Good with early intervention, but may develop adhesions or require tenolysis if chronic
description: Inflammation of the flexor tendon sheath with partial tearing of the flexor digitorum superficialis tendon, typically caused by repetitive strain or acute trauma. The condition presents with Kanavel's cardinal signs (tenderness, swelling, pain on extension, and flexion posture).
multiple_choice: Flexor Tenosynovitis with Partial Tendon Rupture
